chargeHist.descr: Intentionally Contact - Order for Misdemeanor Conviction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald L Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Contact - Order for Misdemeanor Conviction [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO COUNT 1 AMENDED:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons.  CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR. CONSECUTIVE TO CASES 15CF4463 AND 15CM3445.

superMiscConds.notes:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, and DV surcharges (for count 4 only) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs; DNA surcharge.

-GED or HSED.
-Seek and Maintain Full-Time Employment.

-Mental Health Assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Parenting Class.
-Domestic Abuse Counseling.

supervisions.notes: The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant Gerald L Williams in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Gerald L Williams in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State has complied with victim notification requirements. State placed negotiations on the record. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. Additional statements made by the victim.

AS TO COUNT 1 AMENDED:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons.  CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR. CONSECUTIVE TO CASES 15CF4463 AND 15CM3445.

AS TO COUNT 4:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons. CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR. CONCURRENT TO COUNT 1.

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-ABSOLUTELY NO CONTACT WITH THE VICTIM. 
-Mental Health Assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-AODA
-GED or HSED.
-Parenting Class.
-Seek and Maintain Full-Time Employment.
-Domestic Abuse Counseling.
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, and DV surcharges (for count 4 only) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs; DNA surcharge.

The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel. 

FILED:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Gerald L Williams in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Defendant Gerald L Williams in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: CH
Case set for Plea Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. As to Count 1; Court orders Domestic Abuse Assessments modifier dismissed.


AS TO COUNTS 2 and 3: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered counts dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS 1 and 4:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by the parties to criminal complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint. Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 08/06/18 at 8:30 am, branch 28. Jury Trial scheduled for 08/06/18 at 8:30am, branch 28, is cancelled.
